title: Welcome to My Cross-Stitch Blog!
text:
Hello, Stitching World!
Iâ€™m so excited to start this blog! Iâ€™ve been cross-stitching for a while now, but I realized I wasnâ€™t keeping track of all the wonderful things I was learning along the way.

Why Start a Blog?
Learning Documentation: Every project teaches me something new - techniques, color combinations, problem-solving approaches. I want to remember these lessons!
Community Connection: The cross-stitch community is incredibly welcoming and supportive. Iâ€™d love to connect with fellow stitchers and share experiences.
Progress Motivation: Thereâ€™s something motivating about documenting progress. It helps me see how far Iâ€™ve come!


What to Expect
Project Updates: Regular posts about my current works in progress, including photos and reflections on what Iâ€™m learning.
Technique Tips: When I figure out a tricky technique or find a helpful method, Iâ€™ll share it here.
Pattern Reviews: Honest thoughts about patterns Iâ€™ve worked, including difficulty level and any modifications I made.
Supply Reviews: My thoughts on different fabrics, threads, and tools as I try them.

title: My Cross-Stitch Projects
text:
Hereâ€™s a showcase of my cross-stitch projects, from works in progress to treasured completed pieces.




Completed: September 2025 Fabric: 14-count white Aida
Threads: DMC cotton floss



Finished photo


This cute design features intricate leaf patterns with beautiful color blending. Iâ€™m learning advanced shading techniques and loving every stitch!
Challenges: - Mastering French knots for texture - Color blending for realistic leaves - Maintaining consistent tension across the large design







Completed: August 2024
Fabric: 14-count white Aida



Finished photo


My first completed project this year! A delicate floral design perfect for marking my place in stitching magazines.
What I Learned: - Basic cross-stitch fundamentals - How to finish edges properly - The importance of good lighting



Completed: June 2024
Fabric: 14-count white Aida



Blue Jay


A traditional sampler with alphabet, numbers, and a charming house motif. This piece holds special meaning as it was my grandmotherâ€™s pattern.
Techniques Used: - Basic cross-stitch - Backstitch for outlines - Simple border patterns







A complex landscape piece Iâ€™m planning for the holiday season.



Converting a beautiful vintage pattern into a decorative pillow.

Each project teaches me something new. The journey is just as rewarding as the destination!
